article.headline: Manhattan 76, Fordham 60
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Peter Mulligan matched his career-high with 31 points and Manhattan beat Fordham 76-60 on Saturday night, the Jaspers' fourth straight win over their intraborough rival. Freshmen C.J. Anderson and Arturo Dubois added 16 and 14 points, respectively, for Manhattan (3-0), which leads the series over its fellow Bronx school 50-47. Mulligan, a senior swingman, was 12-for-15 from the field, and Anderson and Dubois were both 7-for-9 to lead the Jaspers' 62.7 percent effort from the field (32-for-51). Manhattan, playing its first road game of the season, shot 70.4 percent in the second half (19-for-27). Mulligan had 31 points as a freshman at Maryland-Baltimore County and his best effort since transferring to Manhattan was 28 points against Loyola, Md., last season. Jermaine Anderson had 19 points for Fordham (1-2), while freshmen Bryant Dunston and Marcus Stout each added 13. Dubois had six points as Manhattan opened the second half with a 10-2 run to take a 46-31 lead with 15:45 to play. The Jaspers' biggest lead was 72-51 on a dunk by Anderson with 3:56 left. Fordham shot 43.1 percent from the field (22-for-51), but committed 16 turnovers which Manhattan converted into 19 points.
